name: Lloyd's of London
goal: Lloyd's provides a specialist insurance and reinsurance market based in London. Its legal form is recognised by the EU Insurance and Reinsurance Directives. Its membership comprises of corporate and individual members, each of whom accepts insurance risk on their own account via their membership of Lloyd's underwriting syndicates. Lloyd's is authorised to write insurance from all EU Member States and provides reinsurance to more than 200 countries and territories worldwide.
interests: Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Institutional affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Trade
euInitiatives: Brexit, EU trade negotiations, Solvency II, Insurance Distribution Directive, Data Protection, European System of Financial Supervision review, Network and Information Security Directive
